name: DataShare
headline: Embed charts, dashboards and exports in your app
description: DataShare is a data-as-a-service platform that lets you embed charts, dashboards and exports directly into your product. For example, if you run an accounting startup, DataShare would enable you to embed a full profit and loss dashboard, with downloadable statements. DataShare is backed by an enterprise-grade data warehouse, and can be implemented in fewer than 20 lines of code.

founders.name: Brian Brunner, Founder
founders.description: Founder of DataShare, previously was the engineering manager for the team at Stripe that built Sigma and Data Pipeline.

# Give your customers analytics, insights and exports that they'll love
Add all the data products your customers want - charts, dashboards, data exports, and more - in record time with minimal code.
[Chat With Us](http://datashare.co/<#>)
## Powerful Data Products Directly In Your App
Add data products your customers need quickly with minimal engineering
1
Setup Data Sources
Link a data source like a database, spreadsheet or warehouse and define your reporting schemas.
2
Configure Components
Select the charts, tables, exports and data syncs your customers need via our intuitive UI. No code needed.
3
Go Live!
Give your customers a link to a hosted analytics site, or embed components directly in your app.
## Seamless Integration With Your Exisiting Stack
DataShare works with the database, backend and frontend you already use. We'll fit in perfectly with your infrastructure.
![Integrations](http://datashare.co/static/media/Integrations.2b0d2e44c0be440a0e38.png)

generated_description:
**Overview of DataShare**

Founded in 2023 and based in Austin, TX, DataShare is an innovative data-as-a-service platform that’s ready to revolutionize how you embed analytics in your product. If you're running a startup, especially in fields like accounting, imagine effortlessly integrating a comprehensive profit and loss dashboard right within your application. DataShare makes this possible with an incredibly simple implementation—less than 20 lines of code.

**Mission and Value Proposition**

DataShare’s mission is clear: to empower developers to embed charts, dashboards, and data exports seamlessly within their applications. It allows businesses to provide their customers with valuable analytics and insights—essentially enriching the user experience without a heavy lift in engineering resources. This means you can add all the data products your users crave, like charts and exports, in record time.

**How It Works**

The process is straightforward:
1. **Setup Data Sources**: Connect to various data sources—be it a database, spreadsheet, or data warehouse—and establish your reporting schemas.
2. **Configure Components**: Choose the charts, tables, and exports your customers need through a user-friendly interface, requiring no coding skills.
3. **Go Live!**: Launch your analytics site or embed the components directly in your app, providing immediate value to your users.

**Integration with Existing Systems**

One of DataShare's standout features is its seamless integration with your current tech stack. It’s designed to complement whatever databases, backends, and frontends you’re already using, so you don’t have to reinvent the wheel.

**Backing and Growth**

DataShare is part of Y Combinator's Batch S23 and is bolstered by strong mentorship, including support from group partner Harj Taggar. Currently, it has a petite but dedicated team of one, highlighting a focus on agility and innovation.

**Targeted Audience**

The company operates in the realms of analytics, data engineering, and databases, catering specifically to developers and businesses looking for smart data solutions. 

To explore further, visit [DataShare's website](http://datashare.co/) or get in touch through their contact options. If you're looking to enhance your application's data capabilities, DataShare might just be what you need.
